skill.name: github-project-management
skill.description: Comprehensive GitHub project management with swarm-coordinated issue tracking, project board automation, and sprint planning
skill.summary: Comprehensive GitHub project management with swarm-coordinated issue tracking, project board automat...
skill.author: Claude Code

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance for GitHub project management workflows. No executable code, no network operations, no file system access, no environment variable reading. External tools (gh CLI, ruv-swarm) are invoked by the user, not by this skill.

content.user_title: Manage GitHub projects with AI swarm coordination
content.value_statement: Managing GitHub issues, project boards, and sprints across multiple repositories is complex and time-consuming. This skill provides automated swarm-coordinated workflows to create issues, sync project boards, and track sprints efficiently with AI agent coordination.
actual_capabilities: Create and manage GitHub issues with swarm coordination
Automate project board synchronization and card management
Plan and track sprints with velocity and burndown metrics
Decompose issues into subtasks with progress tracking
Coordinate multi-agent swarms for complex project tasks
Generate analytics and reports for team performance
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) installed and authenticated
Depends on ruv-swarm or claude-flow MCP server configuration
GitHub API rate limits apply for high-volume operations
Cannot function without proper repository access permissions

use_cases.title: Coordinate Team Sprints
use_cases.description: Plan sprints, assign tasks, track velocity, and manage project boards with automated swarm coordination across team members.

use_cases.title: Track Issue Progress
use_cases.description: Create feature issues, decompose complex tasks, monitor subtask completion, and update project boards automatically.

use_cases.title: Monitor Project Health
use_cases.description: View sprint progress, track team performance metrics, identify blockers, and generate reports for stakeholder updates.

prompt_templates.title: Create Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GitHub issue titled [title] with body: [description]. Add labels: enhancement, swarm-ready. Assign to [username].

prompt_templates.title: Sync Board
prompt_templates.prompt: Sync all issues with label 'swarm-ready' to the Development project board. Auto-assign cards to agents based on workload.

prompt_templates.title: Start Sprint
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize Sprint 24 using ruv-swarm with auto-populate from backlog, capacity planning, and velocity tracking enabled.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a sprint summary report showing burndown, velocity, completed items, and blockers for the current sprint.

output_examples.input: Create an issue for the new authentication feature and add it to the project board
output: Card added to Development Board in Backlog column
Swarm initialized with 3 agents (architect, coder, tester)

best_practices: Initialize swarm coordination for complex issues involving multiple agents
Use consistent labeling strategy for easy filtering and automation
Configure bidirectional sync between GitHub and project boards for real-time updates
anti_patterns: Creating issues without labels, making automated triage impossible
Manually updating project boards instead of using automated sync
Running swarms on simple single-agent tasks that do not need coordination

faq.question: What GitHub permissions are required?
faq.answer: Repository write access for issue creation and project board management. Admin access needed for webhook configuration.

faq.question: How many issues can this skill handle?
faq.answer: GitHub API rate limits apply. Free accounts: 60 requests/hour. Teams/Enterprises: 5,000 requests/hour.

faq.question: Can I use this with GitHub Enterprise?
faq.answer: Yes. Configure gh CLI with your Enterprise URL. The MCP tools must point to your enterprise GitHub instance.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: All data stays within your GitHub instance. External tools (ruv-swarm) process data locally on your machine.

faq.question: What if project board sync fails?
faq.answer: Run board-diagnose to check permissions and rate limits. Enable bidirectional sync validation in settings.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-driven coordination with natural language prompts. GitHub Actions are better for automated CI/CD workflows.
